ygData.subject: Re: How do you use the lull song and Star Wars.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Welcome to the list! I too was surprised that (currently) there are no flames going on and it seems everyone is getting along fine - no complaints here!
ygData.messageBody:
>From: RON_TALBOT@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] How do you use the lull song and Star Wars.
>Date: Thu, 20 May 1999 11:01:36 -0700
>
>From: RON_TALBOT@...
>
> Hello all,
>
> A couple of questions from a new bard on your list. (I apologize
> if these have been asked before) BTW, this is by far the most
> interesting and mature Everquest list that I have seen so far. Must
> say something about the type of person that enjoys playing a bard.
> (join the EQ_clerics list for a bit and you'll see what I mean...)
>

Welcome to the list! I too was surprised that (currently) there are no
flames going on and it seems everyone is getting along fine - no complaints
here!

> 1. Exactly how do you use the Level 8 lull song? Is it an area
> effect song or do you have to target each MOB in turn? Perhaps a
>step
> by step description of the proper tactics to use when facing a group
> of yellwo-blue monsters would best illustrate this. (thanks)
>

I'm waiting for the answer to this myself =)


> 3. I am a Level 10 human Bard. I usually party with an Enchanter
> (good combo, the pet tanks, she zaps and I tank/support) but I am
> rather poor. Any good suggestions on location or MOBS that garner a
> goodly amount of loot so I can finish my banded ensemble?
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Bujold (Xegony) (look no e.. :))
>

Depends on where you currently are hanging out. I was mostly in Beholder
around that level with a group. Hunting minos for their axes and a horn (for
later use). Also spent quite a bit of time in the North Ro desert. If you
are on Faydwer I would say try for Crushbone, the Lesser Fay bandits, the
Butcherblock Orcs, or maybe the Steamfont skeletons (I think your a little
high for the skellies though?). Near Freeport, I would suggest Desert of Ro.
Lots of wandering mobs. Near Qeynos I would suggest Blackburrow. I also hear
West Karanas has some good hunting grounds, though I have never tried there.
Actually tons of other places to go.

Sartori of Kelethin
